agenda.description: ** REVISION ** SENATE NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Business & Commerce TIME & DATE: 8:00 AM, Tuesday, April 30, 2019 PLACE: E1.012 (Hearing Room) CHAIR: Senator Kelly Hancock SB 125 West Relating to the term of a parking permit issued to a residential tenant by a landlord. HB 125 Martinez SP: Menéndez Relating to the online publication of home addresses of certain occupational license holders. HB 387 Cortez SP: Creighton Relating to submission of reports by an advanced practice registered nurse under the workers' compensation system. SB 518 Zaffirini Relating to remedies after certain casualty losses to residential rental premises. SB 523 Hinojosa | et al. Relating to the consequences of a criminal conviction on a person's eligibility for an occupational license. SB 699 Hall Relating to the certification of an area's wet or dry status for the purpose of an alcoholic beverage permit or license. SB 732 Hughes | et al. Relating to the regulation of the practice of physical therapy. HB 1385 King, Tracy O. SP: Hancock Relating to the regulation of industrialized housing and buildings. SB 1463 Hughes Relating to the availability of financial information of nonprofit corporations for public inspection. HB 1523 Nevárez SP: Buckingham Relating to the continuation of the regulation of land surveyors and the transfer of the regulation to the Texas Board of Professional Engineers and Land Surveyors, following the recommendations of the Sunset Advisory Commission; changing fees. HB 1554 Smithee SP: Zaffirini Relating to the language of personal automobile or residential property insurance policy documents and related materials. HB 1555 Smithee SP: Zaffirini Relating to the status of personal automobile or residential property insurance policy summary documents. HB 1940 Lucio III SP: Creighton Relating to eligibility of surplus lines insurers to provide windstorm and hail coverage. HB 1944 Lucio III | et al. SP: Hancock Relating to extension of deadlines for claims and related settlement and dispute resolution under the Texas Windstorm Insurance Association Act. HB 2228 Geren | et al. SP: Huffman Relating to the inspection of certain boilers. SB 2551 Hinojosa Relating to the liability of certain political subdivisions for certain workers' compensation claims and actions. HB 2585 Leach | et al. SP: Zaffirini Relating to civil works projects and other construction projects of governmental entities. Pending Business Public testimony will be limited to 3 minutes. If submitting written testimony, please provide 20 copies to the committee clerk with your name and bill number on each copy. Please register for this hearing using the Senate kiosk located in the extension hallways or by going to http://swrs. Bills added after last posting: HB 2585 Bills deleted after last posting: SB 1503 ** See Committee Coordinator for previous versions of the schedule **
